intro: Triplolepis, commonly known as the false thimbleweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species native to southern Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa, Namibia, and Zimbabwe. The plants are typically herbaceous, with slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Their leaves are usually alternate, finely divided, and have a slightly hairy texture. Triplolepis species are often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops, thriving in dry to moist conditions.
